strings.generic.lonely: Heh... it's pretty empty, eh? I guess it's like a set of hearts, only one can be the chosen one! But, I shouldn't give you an extensional crisis right now. Go have fun! ...and maybe touch grass, you really seem to be lacking in that department x3
strings.errors.ownerOnly: You are not allowed to invoke the **${name}** command.
strings.errors.missingPermsBot: I am currently missing the following permissions: **${perms}**
strings.errors.missingPermsUser: You are currently missing the following permissions: **${perms}**
strings.errors.cooldown: You are currently on cooldown for command **${command}** for **${time}**.
errors.unknown.dev: Sorry! I was not able to execute the ${prefix} **${command}**! :<
If this keeps erroring, please report it to:
Since you are in development mode, the stacktrace can be seen below
errors.unknown.prod: Sorry! I was not able to execute the ${prefix} **${command}**! :<
If this keeps erroring, please report it to:
on the Noelware Discord server under the <#824071651486335036> channel:
strings.descriptions.admin.automod: Command to update your automod settings!
strings.descriptions.automod.messageLinks: Toggles the Message Links automod -- read more [here](https://nino.sh/docs/automod/message-links)
strings.descriptions.automod.accountAge: Toggles the Account Age automod or sets a threshold -- read more [here](https://nino.sh/docs/automod/account-age)
strings.descriptions.automod.dehoist: Toggles the Dehoisting automod -- read more [here](https://nino.sh/docs/automod/dehoisting)
strings.descriptions.automod.blacklist: Toggles the Blacklist automod, or add/remove/list blacklisted words. -- read more [here](https://nino.sh/docs/automod/blacklist)
strings.descriptions.automod.phishing: Toggles the Phishing Links automod -- read more [here](https://nino.sh/docs/automod/phishing)
strings.descriptions.automod.toxicity: Toggles the Toxicity automod -- read more [here](https://nino.sh/docs/automod/toxicity)
strings.descriptions.automod.spam: Toggles the Spam automod -- read more [here](https://nino.sh/docs/automod/spam)
strings.descriptions.automod.raid: Toggles the Raid automod -- read more [here](https://nino.sh/docs/automod/raid)
strings.descriptions.automod.invites: Toggles the Invites automod -- read more [here](https://nino.sh/docs/automod/invites)
strings.descriptions.automod.mentions: Toggles the Mentions automod, or sets a mention threshold. -- read more [here](https://nino.sh/docs/automod/mentions)
strings.descriptions.admin.export: Exports your guild settings to be easily imported later on.
strings.descriptions.admin.import: Import your exported guild settings easily. You can't revert back once you import back.
strings.descriptions.logging.omitUsers: Add or remove users to omit from being logged in the specified log channel.
strings.descriptions.logging.omitChannels: Add or remove text channels to omit from being logged in the specified log channel.
strings.descriptions.logging.events: Toggle specific logging events -- read more [here](https://nino.sh/docs/logging)
strings.descriptions.prefix: Creates, views, and deletes the guild or your prefixes.
strings.descriptions.prefix.set: Adds a prefix to the list of prefixes that you or the guild can use, depends on your desire!
strings.descriptions.prefix.delete: Removes a prefix from the list of prefixes that you or the guild doesn't like, but it doesn't hurt to delete any... right?
strings.descriptions.core.help: Returns documentation on a command or module, or a list of commands you can use.
commands.admin.logging.omitUsers.embed.d: Here is a list of users that are omitted from being logged:
strings.commands.admin.logging.omitUsers.add.mis: You are missing users to omit from logging! You can use one or more mentions or user IDs.
strings.commands.admin.logging.omitUsers.404: I was unable to find the users to omit. Did you specify a mention or user ID?
strings.commands.admin.logging.omitUsers.del.mis: Missing user(s) to remove from the omitted list.
strings.commands.admin.logging.omitChannels.404: I was unable to find the channels to omit. Did you specify a mention or channel ID? Did you specify only voice channels?
You are missing text channels to omit from logging! You can use one or more mentions or channel IDs.
Missing channel(s) to remove from the omitted list.
commands.admin.logging.omitChannels.embe: Here is a list of text channels that are omitted from being logged:
strings.commands.admin.logging.success: ${emoji} Successfully set the logging channel to ${channel}!
strings.commands.admin.logging.invalid: Argument **${arg}** was not a valid channel mention or ID.
commands.admin.logging.events.list.embed: This is a list of logging events that are enabled or disabled.
Read our [Terms of Service](https://nino.sh/terms) & [Privacy Policy](https://nino.sh/privacy) before enabling!
commands.admin.prefix.user.list: > You can also use the following default prefixes as well:
commands.admin.prefix.guild.list: > You can also use the following default prefixes as well:
strings.commands.admin.prefix.set.noPermission: You are currently missing the **Manage Guild** permission to modify guild prefixes.
strings.commands.admin.prefix.set.missingPrefix: You are missing a prefix to set. You can use `"` to use spaces in your prefixes. (example: `"nino is the best"` -> `nino is the best help`)
strings.commands.admin.prefix.set.maxLengthExcee: You went **${chars.over}** characters over the limit with the prefix you supplied: ${prefix}
strings.commands.admin.prefix.reset.unavailable: Prefix ${prefix} is now unavailable, if you want to add it back, then say so!
Hello again! I am here to remind you that you are missing a prefix to remove.
But don't worry, I will list them again for you... don't expect this to happen again!
Just specify the prefix below to remove it (example):
commands.admin.prefix.reset.user.embed.d: Hello again! I am here to remind you that you are missing a prefix to remove.
But don't worry, I will list them again for you... don't expect this to happen again!
Just specify the prefix below to remove it (example):
